channel.title: WorldController - What is it and how do I find it?
channel.description: What is the world controller class? How do I find it? Does anyone know what class it is for #489?

item.title: WorldController - What is it and how do I find it?
item.dc:creator: @solarwind solarwind
item.description:
@solarwind wrote:

yakman:

[quote author=frank_ link=topic=252135.msg2110104#msg2110104 date=1205576201]idiot…

agreed, that kind of stuff is stupid to the extream,
the train of thought should go, “i need to find a way to get where a rock/tree/bank booth is”, “ill investigate a bit”, “i found you can use ground array and object UIDs for that”, “proceed to write patterns for those fields”

but your train of thought seems to be “i need to match every field i saw in other peoples updaters”, “ill try those worldcontroller/groundarray/objectUIDs now”
and if you did make an updater for them, you would have no idea what they do, and might as well not have found them

this reminds me a bit of those people who find the fields byteBuffer, position, Packet.
i say to them “do you really want to read from the packet and parse its contense?”, the answer is “not really, id much rather read from the other fields”, so why did you find them in the first place?

when the worldcontroller became static and broken up, i investigated a bit and posted what i found, what the new structure was and possible ways of finding those fields, try to find that post if you want[/quote]
I need to find the objects to find objects on the ground -.-

Read full topic
item.source: WorldController - What is it and how do I find it?

item.title: WorldController - What is it and how do I find it?
item.dc:creator: @yakman yakman
item.description:
@yakman wrote:

frank_:

idiot…

agreed, that kind of stuff is stupid to the extream,
the train of thought should go, “i need to find a way to get where a rock/tree/bank booth is”, “ill investigate a bit”, “i found you can use ground array and object UIDs for that”, “proceed to write patterns for those fields”

but your train of thought seems to be “i need to match every field i saw in other peoples updaters”, “ill try those worldcontroller/groundarray/objectUIDs now”
and if you did make an updater for them, you would have no idea what they do, and might as well not have found them

this reminds me a bit of those people who find the fields byteBuffer, position, Packet.
i say to them “do you really want to read from the packet and parse its contense?”, the answer is “not really, id much rather read from the other fields”, so why did you find them in the first place?

when the worldcontroller became static and broken up, i investigated a bit and posted what i found, what the new structure was and possible ways of finding those fields, try to find that post if you want

Read full topic
item.source: WorldController - What is it and how do I find it?

why are you trying to find stuff that you do not know what it does?
[/quote]
For fun…[/quote]idiot…

item.title: WorldController - What is it and how do I find it?
item.dc:creator: @solarwind solarwind
item.description:
@solarwind wrote:

[quote=“Ollie, post:4, topic:189264”][quote author=solarwind link=topic=252135.msg2109323#msg2109323 date=1205553720]

it no longer exists as a singleton, its static and split up.

Damnit!
Then how do I find the ObjectUIDs? And the Objects? All I found is Object5Array…
[/quote]
they are all in the Tile (“Ground”) Class, all object type fields, should be enough to help, you have my msn messenger address if you wish to speak[/quote]

Thanks so much for that! That cleared it up![br][br][size=1]Posted on: March 15, 2008, 12:24:03 AM[/size][hr]Ok, all of th Objects are declared in the Ground class but how do I find them specifically? Also, how do I find the ObjectUIDs?

Read full topic
item.source: WorldController - What is it and how do I find it?

it no longer exists as a singleton, its static and split up.
[/quote]
Damnit!
Then how do I find the ObjectUIDs? And the Objects? All I found is Object5Array…[/quote]
they are all in the Tile (“Ground”) Class, all object type fields, should be enough to help, you have my msn messenger address if you wish to speak
